basics.name: James Wright
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: Software Developer with more than 13 years of experience developing effective user experiences and the systems to enable them. Strong focus on the intersection of Product, Design and Engineering.

work.summary: Masabi provides a fare collection platform to public transit agencies around the world.
highlights: Provide voice for 5 frontend engineers across 2 teams as a member of the tech strategy board
Lead hiring drive to fill several open frontend roles
De-risk UI milestones and projects that are in the critical path for major platform changes
Developed an analytics/visualisation UI, realtime telemetry and device health dashboard, bulk records processing interfaces and many more features
Lead migration of product from AngularJS to Vue without needing any roadmap downtime
Worked closely with the design team to build a design system and component library to make prototyping and iteration faster and more consistent
Coach an intermediate frontend engineer and QA analyst that is pursuing becoming a frontend engineer
All of the above happened while the company grew from serving a handful of transport agencies to more than 70 without needing to increase the headcount until this year

work.summary: I always seem to come across unique opportunities to try new technologies and get paid to do it
highlights: Create several informational/utility mobile apps for provincial Midwife organisations to assist in the diagnosis and treatment of their clients
Create several mobile and progressive web apps for interactive real estate development showroom displays

work.summary: ACL Services (now Galvanize) develops a SaaS platform for the governance, risk management and compliance industry.
highlights: Developed configurable KPI visualisation and alerting functionality in the analytics product
Worked closely with the design team on the companies internal design system and component library

work.summary: Anow is a SaaS platform that provides an all-in-one solution for real estate appraisal/valuation businesses.
highlights: Developed CRM, invoicing, notifications, booking management features using AngularJS and .NET
Introduced agile methodologies, automated builds, git workflow, code reviews etc... to the development team
Lead hiring of 2 additional developers as the company went from launch to first few hundred thousand in revenue
Built highly interactive Dragon Age franchise website which included a custom navigable game world map, user comments, character bios and many other features
Worked on several other franchise websites including Dawn Gate, Fifa World, Sims and internal productivity tools
Introduced automated performance testing, increased unit test coverage and ran weekly cross-team frontend engineering meeting
Built websites many small to medium-sized businesses using HTML5, CSS3 and jQuery and in-house content management system
Developed photo gallery feature for the in-house CMS product
Developed mobile web UI for Bacardi True Originals which was a sponsored social network for bartenders based around a series of competitions
Maintained and updated content features for the Nike Golf website
Built boilerplate template to create highly interactive websites for Jordan brand shoe releases along with the websites using this template, several of these won FWA awards
Developed several websites using HTML, CSS, PHP, Flash and Javascript for companies of varied size
Developed several websites, applications and in-browser games using Flash and PHP
